detailsOfAchievement: We assist various schools, colleges and institutions involved in the field of education. We are also involved in providing technical and vocational assistance. Provide legal assistance to the poor and downtrodden. Take up civic and humanitarian issues in the city of Mumbai especially in the slums. Advocated the establishment of a centre for APMC to control rates of vegetable & fruits, to enable the local population to get vegetable, fruits & poultry products at reasonable rates. Protect the land that was allotted for parks and playgrounds from encroachment. Took up the issue for better &uninterrupted proper supply of electricity to consumers. The Trust is involved in providing medical relief to hospitals, dispensaries, convalescent homes, asylums and nursing homes. We grant medical help to the poor and other deserving persons during epidemic, famine, floods, earthquakes and other unforeseen calamities. We also help rehabilitate mentally retarded people. In rural areas we organise talks on the ill-effects of smoking and chewing tobacco. Eye camps, cancer camps and medical check-ups are also organised. Swachat Abhiyans are organised wherein villagers are encouraged to take care of their environment and the ill effects of indiscriminate chopping of trees are explained to them. Tree plantation dives have been organised to help green rural areas. We have helped in the building of toilets and have advised them about the ill effects of open defecation. Since Physical Health is of great importance, we provide for the maintenance of play grounds, and recreational clubs with the intention of developing Indian sports by providing financial and other assistance to Indian sportsmen and women. We also cater to the needs of people in general by maintenance of gardens, gymnasiums and physical and cultural centres that cater to the all round growth and development of the citizens of this country. Also various other activities such as awareness meetings for tackling malnutrition, improving healthcare, halting distress migration, generating employment, caring for public concerns etc.

detailsOfAchievement: Lata Mangeshkar Hospital (LMH) was inaugurated in the year 1990. This hospital is attached to NKP Salve Institute of Medical Institute of Medical Sciences and Research Centre as its tertiary care hospital. The hospital located at Digdoh Hills serves the people of the nearby villages, people from nearby industrial area and people of city of Nagpur. It has excellent facilities for out-door (OPD) and in-door patients (IPD) at affordable and subsidized rates. The hospital has been recognized by the Employee State Insurance (ESI) Corporation for treatment of its employees and their dependent families. The specialty units and departments of the hospital are well patronized by the people because of its location and its affordable charges. The hospital is well known for providing affordable and quality care since last 25 years of its existence and earned the name and reputation in the region for providing quality health care to needy people!

title: VESHYA AIDS MUQUABLA PARISHAD VAMP
detailsOfAchievement: VAMP (Veshya AIDS Muquabla Parishad) is a community based organisation of sex workers working to address social inequality and to promote justice amongst communities discriminated against because of sex work, HIV status, gender, caste, and being a sexual minority. It focuses on building solidarity amongst marginalized communities by using a rights centred approach to self-determination and organising the voiceless. VAMP aims to empower women in sex work to assert their rights and to work towards a safer and more enjoyable working and living environment. Apart from running a HIV/AIDS programme, they mediate community disputes, lobby with the police, help women access government systems, and develop leadership potential. They are experienced in community outreach and advocacy, have research and training skills, especially with regard to peer education, and have knowledge on anti-trafficking issues from practice. They are now independent sex workers collective with 5.500 members. VAMP works in thedistricts of Sangli, satara, in western Maharashtra and Belgaum, Bagalkot in North Karnataka. Activities: a. Community Outreach to peer based intervention, b. ICTC and referral for medical services at Government set up. c. Condom distribution d. Advocacy, e. Social Entitlements VAMP runs Peer Based HIV prevention, care and support program in North Karnataka. Currently VAMP is running Targeted Intervention Program supported by MSACS (Maharashtra State AIDS Control Society) in the district of Sangli and Satara. Tanta Mukti Samitee:- VAMP decided to develop community solutions. From 2012 , conflict redress committees (Tanta Mukti Samitis -TMS) were formed. TMS organises meetings, resolve local disputes, quarrels, files police complaints for serious issues, hand over violent clients or goondas to police. The Vampâ€™s Collective decision making strengthens collectives and gives them dignity in the eyes of mainstream society. It reduces dependence on mainstream redress mechanisms. VAMP also provides social protection for CABA- Children of Sex Workers, street Children, VAMP initiated a collective for children Mitra (friend) in 2009. VAMP works and believes that Sex workers collectives can lead in strengthening children and ensuring enabling environment for their education, mainstreaming, creating a sustainable community resource. HIV programmes benefit by this resource to keep children safe and to use `insidersâ€™ to run effective HIV interventions Through VAMP Institute; VAMP strengthen the leadership among our own community member, and Advocacy at State, National, International level.
